Text: @bhood37 What is the extension of the file?Is it a .iso image or is it a .vmx image?
The file you're downloading is a single 7-Zip file.  It contains a folder called "iDeneb Mac OSX 10.5.7", and in that folder are all the VMware files for the machine.

I have VmPlayer and it does not open it
Says some thing about foundry ?

Just tested this image using VMPlayer 2.5.2 on an i7 machine.  Loaded and ran just fine.

Are you perhaps running a 32-bit operating system?  Mac OSX 10.5.x requires 64-bit hardware, so if I'm not mistaken, you must be running a 64-bit version of Windows (or other operating system) in order to successfully run this.

@bhood37
Does it matter if I'm running a windows 7 32-bit edition on intel core 2 duo machine?
There is no difference.

@demas113: All my machines are running 64-bit operating systems, so I wasn't sure how this would behave under 32-bit.  If it runs under 32-bit for you, then BRAVO.  :)

To use this image, you need an intel processor with virtualization support  ( enable in bios)

And for the error  "need NX/ED CPU feature" , you need enable in bios the pae function( dep in windows)
